content.content: You must ensure that all records of academic misconduct cases, including but not limited to case documentation, investigation reports, correspondence, evidence submitted, and final outcomes, are retained for a minimum of five years following the case resolution. The Office of the Registrar securely stores these records, and they are accessible only to authorized University Officials. After this retention period, records will be reviewed for archiving or disposal in accordance with institutional policies and legal standards. Exceptions, including but not limited to cases with legal implications or ongoing appeals, may apply. You may request access to your case records by submitting a formal request to the Office of Academic Integrity, subject to confidentiality protocols which ensure that unauthorized individuals Must Not have access to sensitive information. Failure to comply with these protocols will result in disciplinary actions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Appeal Grounds and Process
content.content: You must submit an appeal concerning academic misconduct decisions at Lifelong Agent University only under the following conditions: new evidence emerges, procedural errors are confirmed, or the sanctions are grossly disproportionate to the violation. You must submit a formal written request to the Office of the Provost within 10 business days from the date of decision notification. The Appeals Process includes a comprehensive review by the Academic Integrity Committee, which will evaluate the appeal's validity based on these specified grounds. The Committee will issue a decision within 20 business days, and you will be notified in writing of the outcome. The Committee's decision is final and binding. Non-compliance with these procedures, including but not limited to late submission or inadequate grounds for appeal, will be enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, and you may face additional consequences as defined in the university's guidelines.

content.title: Dormitory Assignment Procedures
content.content: You must submit your housing application to Lifelong Agent University by the deadline specified in your admissions package. You must indicate your preferences for room type, living arrangements, and any special accommodations in the application. However, you must understand that specific requests for dormitory assignments are not guaranteed. You may request changes to dormitory assignments, but these requests are subject to room availability and require approval from the Housing and Residential Education office. You must not assume any assignment changes without confirmation, including but not limited to relocating without notice or swapping with another student without consent. Lifelong Agent University reserves the right to make final decisions on housing assignments to maximize residency operations and community balance. Violations of these procedures will result in disciplinary action as determined by the Office of Student Conduct, consistent with sanctions described elsewhere in the university's guidelines.

content.title: Guest Registration Requirements
content.content: As a resident of Lifelong Agent University, you must register all guests through the online portal at least 24 hours before their visit. You must provide accurate details, including the guest's full name, contact information, and the duration of their stay. Overnight guests are permitted a stay of a maximum of three consecutive nights. You must ensure that your guests adhere to all campus policies. You must not host unauthorized guests, including but not limited to individuals not registered within the required timeframe or those staying beyond the defined duration. Lifelong Agent University reserves the right to limit guest access during special events or peak campus activity periods. The Office of Student Life enforces these requirements, and violations will result in disciplinary actions as outlined in the university's student conduct guidelines.

content.title: Quiet Hours Enforcement
content.content: You must adhere to quiet hours within Lifelong Agent University's residential halls to promote an environment conducive to rest and study. Quiet hours are designated as Sunday through Thursday from 10:00 PM to 8:00 AM, and Friday through Saturday from midnight to 9:00 AM. During these times, you must minimize noise, including but not limited to conversations, music, and other disruptive activities. Resident Assistants and Residential Life staff manage enforcement. Violations will be addressed by the Housing and Residential Education, which may include warnings, discussions with staff, or disciplinary actions as delineated in the university guidelines. You must not violate quiet hours multiple times. Persistent violations, such as repeated loud music, shouting or hosting loud gatherings, will result in escalated disciplinary measures. Special quiet hours are in effect during finals week to ensure optimal study conditions. This policy is enforced by the Housing and Residential Education in alignment with university standards and procedures.

content.title: Property Damage Liability
content.content: You must maintain your assigned living spaces and prevent any damage to University Property. You must not cause damage to residential facilities, furnishings, or communal areas including but not limited to: breaking windows, defacing walls, or damaging furniture. You must report any property damage to Housing and Residential Education within 48 hours. Damage will be assessed by university staff regularly. If responsibility cannot be attributed to a specific individual, repair or replacement costs may be distributed among affected residents. Non-compliance with these property care standards will result in disciplinary actions as outlined in Lifelong Agent University's housing policies, enforced by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Prohibited Appliances List
content.content: You must not use prohibited appliances in any residential facility at Lifelong Agent University. Prohibited appliances include, but are not limited to: space heaters, halogen lamps, toaster ovens, deep fryers, hot plates, and any cooking appliances with exposed heating elements. Additionally, you must not use any device that exceeds the standard electrical load or lacks a designation as safe for use in shared living environments. You must use only approved appliances such as microwaves and mini-fridges with wattage limits specified by Housing and Residential Education. Violations of this policy will result in the confiscation of the item and may lead to disciplinary action as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Room Inspection Protocols
content.content: You must comply with Lifelong Agent University Property standards regarding room upkeep. You must ensure your residence is in accordance with university safety, cleanliness, and maintenance regulations. Room inspections will occur regularly to verify compliance. You must not possess items that violate Residential Life policies, including but not limited to: open flames (candles or incense), unauthorized appliances (such as microwaves, hot plates), or illegal substances. You must maintain cleanliness with floors, surfaces, and furnishings free from excessive clutter or dirt. University Officials will conduct inspections respectfully, safeguarding privacy and personal belongings. You must report maintenance issues to Facilities Management within 48 hours to prevent penalties during inspections. Violations will result in warnings, fines, or corrective actions as determined by the Office of Student Life. The Office of Student Conduct will enforce all protocols, with sanctions outlined in university guidelines. These rules are integral to promoting a safe and conducive learning environment for all students, aligning with Lifelong Agent University's educational and ethical mission.

content.title: Pet Restrictions
content.content: You must not bring unauthorized pets into University Property, including but not limited to: cats, dogs, reptiles, and exotic species. You must submit a formal request with supporting documentation to the Housing and Residential Education office for approval of emotional support animals before bringing them to campus. Emotional support animals and service animals must adhere to specific guidelines, which include leash requirements and cleanliness standards. These guidelines will be provided to you by Housing and Residential Education. Violations of this policy must be reported to the Office of Student Conduct and may result in disciplinary actions as outlined in the University's policies, including financial penalties for damages or cleaning fees.

content.title: Termination of Housing Contracts
content.content: You must submit a written request to the Office of Student Life if you wish to terminate your Lifelong Agent University housing contract. Termination will only be approved for reasons including, but not limited to: violations of campus conduct standards, nonpayment of fees, or voluntary withdrawal from the university. Requests will be assessed within 10 business days, and all decisions are final. Refunds, if applicable, will be prorated based on the duration of occupancy. You must not terminate or abandon University Property without formal approval. Unauthorized termination or abandonment may result in additional fees or penalties. You are advised to consult Housing and Residential Education to understand your obligations and procedures before taking any action. Violations will be subject to sanctions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Network Access Privileges
content.content: You must use the network access privileges provided by Lifelong Agent University solely for academic, administrative, and personal enrichment activities that comply with University policies and ethical guidelines. You must not share your login credentials with unauthorized persons or entities. You must not attempt to disrupt or compromise the campus network. Prohibited activities include, but are not limited to: unauthorized access to other users' data, introducing malware, or performing network scans. You must respect intellectual property rights and must not access materials that are prohibited or offensive, including, but not limited to: illegal downloads, explicit content, or hate speech. Lifelong Agent University reserves the right to monitor, track, and regulate your network activity to ensure security and optimal performance. Continued network access is contingent upon strict adherence to these standards. Violations may result in the suspension of your network privileges and disciplinary action as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Acceptable Use Policy
content.content: You must use Lifelong Agent University’s digital resources, including networks, computers, and online platforms, solely for academic, research, or university-related purposes. You must not engage in unauthorized access or share login credentials. You must not use these resources in a manner that disrupts or harms the systems, including but not limited to: accessing inappropriate content, cyberbullying, or distributing malicious software. Lifelong Agent University monitors the usage of its digital resources to ensure compliance with these standards. Violations of this policy will be addressed by the Office of Student Conduct and may result in disciplinary actions as outlined in other sections of the University's guidelines.

content.title: Data Security Obligations
content.content: You must use your Lifelong Agent University-provided accounts, network access, and digital tools responsibly as a matter of obligation. You must not share personal or academic data without proper Consent from a University Official. You must keep sensitive information, including passwords and student records, confidential by using strong passwords and updating them every 90 days. You must not engage in unauthorized activities using University Property, including but not limited to: accessing restricted digital resources without permission, distributing malicious software, or attempting to bypass security protocols. You must report any suspicious activity or potential data breaches to the Information Technology Services (ITS) within 48 hours. Violations of these standards will result in disciplinary action or restricted access, enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, as outlined in campus policies.

content.title: Copyright Compliance
content.content: You must comply with copyright laws when using digital resources provided by Lifelong Agent University. You must: (1) Use texts, images, videos, or software accessed through University Property in accordance with applicable copyright restrictions; (2) Adhere to licensing agreements provided for educational purposes. You must not: (1) Reproduce copyrighted content without authorization, including but not limited to, scanning and sharing complete textbooks; (2) Distribute unauthorized copies, including but not limited to, digital file sharing of licensed software; (3) Modify copyrighted works, including but not limited to, altering images or videos without consent. If in doubt about permitted uses, you must seek guidance from University Libraries or Information Technology Services (ITS) no later than 48 hours before intended use. Non-compliance with these standards will result in disciplinary actions implemented by the Office of Student Conduct, in alignment with university policies on Academic Misconduct and campus conduct standards.

content.title: Prohibited Online Activities
content.content: You must maintain the integrity, security, and reputation of Lifelong Agent University and its community when engaging in online activities. You must not: access restricted University systems without authorization, share or distribute offensive material, engage in harassment or cyberbullying, misuse University Property such as digital resources, participate in illegal file sharing or copyright infringement, impersonate University staff or representatives, use technology to cheat or commit Academic Misconduct, or spread false information about the University. Violations of these standards will result in disciplinary actions enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, according to the sanctions outlined in Lifelong Agent University's Student Handbook.

content.title: Device Registration Requirements
content.content: You must register all personal or Lifelong Agent University-issued devices that access the University Property network systems. Device registration ensures secure access to digital resources and maintains the integrity of campus operations. You must complete the registration through Lifelong Agent University's online portal, using your student ID and providing device information, including MAC address and device type, within 48 hours of first access. Once registered, you will receive an approval email with network access credentials. You must update the device registration if there are changes to device hardware within 48 hours of those changes. You must not use unregistered devices on the University Property network, including but not limited to: personal laptops, tablets, smartphones, or any other network-enabled devices. Violations will be enforced by the Office of Student Conduct and may result in limited network access or disciplinary action as per Lifelong Agent University's Campus Conduct Standards. These measures are essential to support the educational, safety, and integrity missions of Lifelong Agent University.

content.title: Consequences for Unauthorized Access
content.content: You must access digital resources at Lifelong Agent University only with appropriate consent and authorization. You must not engage in unauthorized activities related to digital resources, including but not limited to: accessing, modifying, or distributing data, accounts, or university property systems without explicit consent. The Office of Student Conduct, in coordination with Information Technology Services (ITS), enforces these rules. Violations are considered academic misconduct and may result in suspension or expulsion as delineated in university conduct standards. For permissions-related queries, contact ITS or review the Digital Resources section of the student handbook.

content.title: Email Communication Standards
content.content: As a student at Lifelong Agent University, you must use your official university email addresses for all academic and campus-related correspondence. You must include a clear subject line, concise yet detailed content, and appropriate salutations and closures in every email. You must not use offensive or inappropriate language, including but not limited to racial slurs, profanities, or derogatory remarks. You must respond to emails within 48 hours and check your university email daily for important updates. Misuse of email for spamming, harassment, or unauthorized sharing of sensitive information is strictly prohibited. Violations of these email communication standards will be subject to disciplinary actions enforced by the Office of Student Conduct as outlined in Lifelong Agent University's conduct policies.

content.title: Evacuation Procedures
content.content: In the event of an evacuation at Lifelong Agent University, you must immediately cease all activities upon hearing the evacuation alarm and proceed to the nearest exit. You must use stairways and must not use elevators; including but not limited to: instances where elevating devices may trap occupants, cause injury, or delay evacuation. You must assist individuals with disabilities when necessary. Follow directional signs and instructions from designated evacuation coordinators. You must make your way to the assembly point specified for your building, which is safely distant from the affected area. Wait at the specified assembly point until clearance is given by university authorities to re-enter or leave University Property. You must stay calm and must not block pathways or emergency access routes; including but not limited to: corridors, stairwells, and egress doors. Regular drills will be conducted to familiarize everyone with evacuation procedures. Violation of this evacuation protocol will be addressed by the Office of Public Safety, which may result in sanctions as outlined by university regulations.

content.title: Emergency Notification Systems
content.content: You must ensure that your contact information is up-to-date in the Lifelong Agent University Emergency Notification Systems to receive alerts within 48 hours of any change. You must not disable or ignore emergency notifications, including but not limited to: university email messages, text messages, mobile app alerts, official website updates, campus loudspeaker broadcasts, and digital screen messages in common areas. Authorized University Officials from the Office of Public Safety will activate the notification systems only after verifying an emergency. Non-compliance will result in disciplinary actions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct. This protocol directly supports the University's mission of safety and preparedness for all students, faculty, and staff on University Property.

content.title: Medical Emergency Response
content.content: In the event of a medical emergency on Lifelong Agent University Property, you must call the campus emergency hotline at [INSERT NUMBER] immediately. If the individual requires urgent medical attention, you must contact local emergency services by dialing 911 without delay. While waiting for professional responders, you must provide basic first aid only if trained, and you must ensure the individual is kept safe and comfortable. Familiarize yourself with locations equipped with first aid kits and automated external defibrillators (AEDs), as identified on the Lifelong Agent University campus map, prior to any emergency. Attend annual safety training sessions provided by the university to stay informed. You must notify University Officials about the situation to facilitate coordination of further assistance or emergency evacuation if needed. You must submit detailed incident reports to the Office of Public Safety within 48 hours after resolving the situation. Non-compliance with these protocols will result in disciplinary actions as determined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Natural Disaster Preparedness
content.content: As a student of Lifelong Agent University, you must monitor official university communication channels, including the emergency notification system and the university website, for real-time updates during a natural disaster. You must familiarize yourself with evacuation routes and designated safe zones within University Property. If University Officials advise evacuation, you must evacuate within one hour, bringing essential items such as identification and emergency supplies. You must not enter damaged buildings or areas marked unsafe by authorities, including but not limited to buildings with structural damage, areas with flooding, or any space cordoned off by emergency personnel. Faculty and staff must ensure that you are accounted for during emergencies. You must report hazardous situations to campus authorities immediately. Participation in all emergency drills organized by Lifelong Agent University is mandatory. If you reside off-campus, you must check local disaster management guidelines and maintain emergency kits. Always prioritize personal safety over belongings. Non-compliance with these protocols will result in sanctions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct. Further details on natural disaster preparedness are available from the Office of Public Safety.

content.title: Campus Closure Criteria
content.content: You must evacuate University Property during a campus closure announced by Lifelong Agent University to ensure safety from specified dangers, including severe weather conditions forecasted by authoritative meteorological agencies such as hurricanes, heavy snowfall, or extreme temperatures; natural disasters like earthquakes or floods that render campus facilities unsafe; public health emergencies involving contagious disease outbreaks; or credible threats to security, including reports of imminent danger or on-campus disturbances. Notifications of closures will be provided within 48 hours through official channels, including email, the university website, and emergency alert systems. Enforcement of evacuation compliance falls under the jurisdiction of the Office of Public Safety. Non-compliance will incur sanctions as detailed elsewhere in university protocols administered by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Crime Reporting Mechanisms
content.content: You must report any crime incidents directly to Lifelong Agent University using one of the designated mechanisms: 1) You must contact the Office of Public Safety by calling the dedicated emergency phone line that is available 24/7; 2) You must submit incident reports through the university's official website under the 'Safety and Security' section; 3) You must utilize designated emergency call boxes located across University Property, which connect directly to the Office of Public Safety; 4) You must visit the Office of Public Safety in person during regular business hours. You must provide detailed information to assist in investigations, and anonymous reporting is allowed if you wish to protect your identity. You must report immediate threats or emergencies by dialing the local emergency services number and subsequently notifying the Office of Public Safety. Failure to comply will result in disciplinary actions outlined by the Office of Student Conduct. All reporting must adhere to University Property protocols to maintain campus safety and integrity.

content.title: Missing Person Protocol
content.content: In the event of a missing person report at Lifelong Agent University, you must immediately contact the Campus Safety Office by dialing the designated emergency number or visiting the office. You must provide all necessary information, including but not limited to: the missing person’s name, last known location, and physical description. Campus Safety must coordinate with local law enforcement when necessary and initiate a thorough search of University Property. University Officials must communicate with the missing person’s emergency contacts and provide updates. You must report any concerns within 48 hours to ensure prompt action. Lifelong Agent University is committed to safeguarding community members and encourages vigilance in maintaining campus security. Non-compliance with these protocols will be referred to the Office of Public Safety and may result in sanctions as defined in the University regulations.

content.title: Trauma Support Services
content.content: You must utilize the trauma support services offered by Lifelong Agent University when experiencing emergencies or distressing situations. You must access these resources through the Campus Wellness Center between the hours of 8 AM to 6 PM on weekdays. In cases of severe trauma, you must engage with personalized recovery plans that may include referrals to external specialists. You must also participate in group therapy sessions addressing common challenges such as grief or anxiety, which are held weekly and open to all students. You must not ignore signs of distress and must not disregard the requirement for professional assessment, including but not limited to: failing to seek help when experiencing severe emotional distress, or refusing personalized recovery plans when recommended by a University Official. Violations of these protocols will be managed by the Office of Student Life and may result in sanctions as outlined elsewhere in the University guidelines. Lifelong Agent University emphasizes care and support, ensuring you overcome obstacles while maintaining well-being throughout your academic journey.

content.title: Alcohol Consumption Restrictions
content.content: You must not consume alcohol if you are under the legal drinking age of 21. You must seek approval from the designated University Official before organizing on-campus events involving alcohol. You must utilize a licensed server to ensure alcohol distribution complies with all relevant laws. You must not possess open containers of alcohol in public areas, including but not limited to: University Property such as sidewalks, parks, study lounges, and dining areas. You must comply with housing restrictions on alcohol quantities and adhere to guidelines for storage within University housing. You must be aware that violations of these policies will be adjudicated by the Office of Student Conduct and may result in disciplinary actions, including mandatory educational programs or suspension. You are encouraged to consume responsibly and seek assistance through campus health services if needed.

content.title: Illicit Drug Prohibition
content.content: You must not use, possess, distribute, or manufacture illicit drugs on University Property, including but not limited to residence halls, academic buildings, and recreational facilities, or at university-sponsored events. This prohibition applies to all students, faculty, staff, and visitors. Specific examples include, but are not limited to: marijuana, cocaine, heroin, ecstasy, methamphetamines, unauthorized prescription medications. Violations of this prohibition will result in disciplinary actions enforced by the Office of Student Conduct. Disciplinary actions may include suspension, expulsion, or legal consequences in accordance with local, state, or federal laws. Lifelong Agent University is committed to providing a safe environment and offers educational programs for drug prevention and awareness. Students seeking assistance for substance-related issues are strongly encouraged to contact the campus health center or counseling services for confidential support. Maintaining a healthy environment is critical for academic success and personal well-being within the university community.

content.title: Smoking/Vaping Designated Areas
content.content: You must only smoke or vape in designated areas on Lifelong Agent University Property. Designated areas are clearly marked with signage and located in open-air spaces away from building entrances, windows, and commonly frequented pedestrian walkways. You must not smoke or vape outside of designated areas, including but not limited to: building entrances, within 20 feet of windows, or on pedestrian walkways. Violations will be strictly enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, and you may face disciplinary action as outlined in the University's conduct policies. Lifelong Agent University supports a smoke-free initiative and provides resources such as counseling and cessation programs for those wishing to quit smoking or vaping.

content.title: Prescription Medication Controls
content.content: You must use prescription medication responsibly and in compliance with legal and medical guidelines at Lifelong Agent University. You must ensure all medications are prescribed by a licensed healthcare provider and must use them solely as the individual listed on the prescription. You must store medications securely on University Property. You must not share or distribute prescription medications, including but not limited to: passing them to friends, selling them, or leaving them in communal areas. Misuse, including but not limited to: excessive use, alteration of prescribed dosages, or using someone else's prescription is strictly prohibited. If your prescription involves controlled substances, you must provide documentation upon request for verification purposes by the Office of Student Conduct. You are strongly advised to inform campus health services if you require any special accommodations related to your prescriptions within 48 hours. Any violation of these regulations will result in disciplinary action by the Office of Student Conduct, as aligned with Lifelong Agent University’s Code of Conduct. You are encouraged to contact campus health services if you have questions regarding proper medication management.

content.title: Testing and Screening Procedures
content.content: You must comply with Lifelong Agent University's testing and screening procedures to ensure a safe and healthy campus environment. Authorized University Officials may conduct random screenings, and you must undergo testing, such as urine analysis or other approved methods, within 48 hours when participating in campus activities that raise safety concerns. You must ensure testing is administered in a controlled setting to guarantee privacy and accuracy. You must not refuse to comply or attempt to falsify results, including but not limited to altering samples, bribing personnel, or providing false information. Violations will result in disciplinary actions enforced by the Office of Student Conduct. Test results are confidential and shared only with authorized individuals. If concerned about accuracy, you may request a retest within 24 hours of receiving initial results. The Office of Student Conduct oversees compliance, ensuring adherence to the substance policies and privacy laws. Disciplinary measures will align with other sanctions outlined in the University's guidelines.

content.title: Rehabilitation Resources
content.content: You must utilize the Rehabilitation Resources provided by Lifelong Agent University to address substance-related challenges. This includes contacting the university's counseling center for confidential assessments and personalized support plans. You must not ignore these resources; doing so will result in consequences, including but not limited to: mandatory counseling sessions, referral to local rehabilitation experts, suspension of university privileges, and other disciplinary actions. You are encouraged to participate in peer support networks and educational workshops to promote substance awareness and positive decision-making. For immediate assistance, you must contact the 24/7 hotline. The Office of Student Conduct will oversee compliance with these guidelines, and any violation will be subject to sanctions as outlined in the university's code of conduct. Lifelong Agent University ensures all rehabilitation services are provided with full discretion and respect for privacy.

content.title: Social Event Regulations
content.content: You must ensure that social events at Lifelong Agent University provide a safe and inclusive environment for all students. You must comply with local laws and University policies regarding alcohol, including age restrictions and consumption limits. You must seek prior approval through the official campus event registration system, providing a detailed plan outlining security measures, crowd management, and emergency protocols. Only licensed individuals or organizations may serve alcohol, and you must make non-alcoholic beverages readily available. You must not allow illegal substances at any events, including but not limited to: marijuana, cocaine, and unauthorized prescription drugs. As an event host, you must maintain a safe atmosphere by monitoring guest behavior and addressing issues within 48 hours. Violations of these regulations will be addressed by the Office of Student Conduct and may result in disciplinary actions as outlined in the Lifelong Agent University’s code of conduct. These rules are rationally related to the University’s mission of ensuring safety, fairness, and compliance with legal standards.

content.title: Parental Notification Policy
content.content: As a student at Lifelong Agent University, you must adhere to the University's Substance Policies. If you are under the age of 21, the University will notify your parents or guardians in cases involving violations of these policies. This includes, but is not limited to: the possession, use, or distribution of alcohol or controlled substances on University Property or at University-sponsored events, regardless of location. Notifications will be made in strict compliance with federal, state, and institutional regulations, including the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA). This policy is designed to promote accountability and support your wellbeing by encouraging communication with your family. The Dean of Students Office is responsible for enforcing this policy, and any infractions will result in consequences as outlined in the university's code of conduct, including possible disciplinary actions. Exceptions to parental notification may be granted under specific circumstances as determined by University Officials.

content.title: Library Access Privileges
content.content: You must possess a valid Lifelong Agent University ID to access Library services. Library hours change with the academic semester and offer extended availability during exam periods. You must not exceed borrowing limits, which vary based on item type, and all materials must be returned on or before due dates to avoid further penalties. Overdue materials incur fines that you must clear within 48 hours to retain borrowing privileges. You must not misuse library property, including but not limited to: defacing books, damaging study spaces, or violating digital resource terms of service. You may reserve group study rooms online, adhering to availability rules. Copying and printing services require payment of a nominal fee, and assistance is available at the reference desk or through authorized university email. You must follow the library's code of conduct without exception. The Office of Student Conduct will enforce these rules, and violations will be subject to sanctions as outlined in other sections of the student conduct code. Considerate behaviors and respect for University Property align with Lifelong Agent University's commitment to educational excellence.

content.title: Equipment Borrowing Policies
content.content: You must submit borrowing requests for University Property online via the Lifelong Agent University portal at least 48 hours in advance. You must specify the type of equipment, intended usage, and duration of need. You must ensure borrowed equipment is returned in its original condition by the agreed deadline. Late returns must not occur, and include but are not limited to: returning equipment after the agreed deadline, leaving equipment at an unapproved location, or failing to notify the university official overseeing equipment returns prior to the deadline. Damaged equipment must be immediately reported to the Facilities Management office; repair costs may be charged to you. You must present a valid university ID at the time of pick-up and adhere to the University's equipment care guidelines. The Office of Student Conduct and Facilities Management reserves the right to impose sanctions, including fines and suspension of borrowing privileges, as outlined in the university's policies on Academic Misconduct and University Property usage.

content.title: Laboratory Safety Protocols
content.content: You must complete mandatory safety training administered by Lifelong Agent University before accessing University Property for laboratory activities. You must wear personal protective equipment designated by laboratory-specific guidelines, including but not limited to lab coats, goggles, and gloves. You must not eat, drink, or smoke within the laboratory premises; prohibited activities include but are not limited to consuming any food, drinks, or tobacco products. You must familiarize yourself with emergency procedures and precisely identify the location of eyewash stations, safety showers, and fire extinguishers as highlighted in training materials. You must use all equipment strictly according to instructions provided by the University Official or outlined in your training. You must handle chemicals according to their Material Safety Data Sheets, and you must report broken equipment or chemical spills immediately, specifically within 30 minutes of discovery, to the laboratory supervisor. You must not conduct unauthorized experiments, which include but are not limited to any procedures not explicitly approved by a University Official. You must adhere to all operating hours and rules specified by the academic departments of Lifelong Agent University, and any violations will be handled by the Office of Student Conduct with sanctions as described in the guidelines. This protocol serves to align with the University's mission of fostering a secure, responsible academic environment prioritizing educational, safety, and integrity standards fairly among all University Property users.

content.title: Research Material Handling
content.content: You must adhere to the guidelines for borrowing, using, and returning research materials from Lifelong Agent University Property, including the library and laboratories. You must return borrowed items by their designated due date to avoid penalties. You must not remove or misuse research materials without authorization. Examples of unauthorized actions include but are not limited to: taking materials off-site without consent, altering or damaging items, and using materials for non-academic purposes. You must access digital materials responsibly, complying with copyright laws and proper citation practices. You must handle physical equipment and resources with care to prevent damage, as repair or replacement costs may be billed to you. For additional information or assistance, you may contact the respective facility's staff during operating hours. The Office of Student Conduct is responsible for enforcing these rules, and violations may result in disciplinary actions as outlined in other sections of the conduct guidelines. This policy supports productive research and promotes respect for shared resources.

content.title: Classroom Reservation System
content.content: You must use the Classroom Reservation System provided by Lifelong Agent University to schedule academic spaces, such as classrooms, for lectures, workshops, and study sessions. You must submit your reservation requests through the online portal accessible via the university website, using your login credentials. Your request must include the date, time, purpose, and expected attendance to facilitate proper allocation of university property. You must submit your reservation requests at least three business days in advance to avoid scheduling conflicts. You must not cancel reservations without prompt communication through the same portal, and such cancellations must be made at least 48 hours in advance. You must not misuse academic facilities, including but not limited to: causing damage to university property, failing to adhere to university policies, or engaging in academic misconduct. Violations of these rules will be enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, and may result in restrictions or penalties, per university guidelines. Notifications regarding approval or adjustments of reservations will be sent to your university email.

content.title: Food and Drink Restrictions
content.content: You must not bring or consume any food and beverages, except water in closed containers, inside classrooms, laboratories, libraries, computer labs, and other academic spaces. The prohibition includes, but is not limited to: snacks, meals, hot drinks, and carbonated beverages. You must dispose of waste in designated receptacles provided within the facilities. You must not engage in actions that may damage University Property or disrupt academic activities. Special permissions for food and drink during events in designated areas can be obtained only with prior Consent from a University Official. Violations of these rules will be addressed by the Office of Student Conduct and may result in disciplinary actions as outlined in the University regulations. These policies are in place to preserve the educational environment and functionality of academic spaces at Lifelong Agent University.

content.title: Special Collections Usage
content.content: You must seek prior approval from Lifelong Agent University to access special collections, and access is limited to enrolled students, faculty, and authorized researchers only. You must schedule appointments at least 72 hours in advance to visit, and usage is restricted to designated areas within University Property. You must not attempt to circulate materials; they are non-circulating and may only be reviewed under University Official supervision to ensure preservation. To maintain integrity, handling restrictions apply, including but not limited to: using gloves, avoiding flash photography, and keeping a safe distance. You must adhere to guidelines provided by University Libraries staff. For digital access requests, contact Lifelong Agent University Libraries, and be aware that approval is contingent upon availability. Non-compliance with these stipulations constitutes Academic Misconduct and will be referred to the Office of Student Conduct for review and disciplinary action as outlined in the University policies.

content.title: Off-hours Access Authorization
content.content: You must obtain prior authorization from Lifelong Agent University to access academic facilities during off-hours. 'Off-hours' are defined as any time outside the regular operational hours, which are from 8:00 AM to 10:00 PM on weekdays. You must submit authorization requests to the Office of Academic Services no less than 72 hours in advance, and each request must include a detailed justification for access. If granted, your access will be provided via a temporary electronic key card or a special access code. You must not breach safety protocols or misuse University Property, which includes but is not limited to: ignoring emergency procedures, damaging facilities, or violating intended use purposes. You must comply with all security and usage guidelines, including maintaining cleanliness and not disrupting ongoing maintenance or research activities. The Office of Public Safety will enforce these regulations, and any violations may result in disciplinary actions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Fitness Center Membership
content.content: You must present your university ID to gain access to the fitness center, which is a facility provided by Lifelong Agent University for your physical wellness and recreational activities. As a full-time student, your membership is included in your tuition fees, granting you access during the posted operational hours. Part-time students, faculty, and staff may purchase memberships at a discounted rate. You must adhere to the posted rules and guidelines within the fitness center to ensure a safe and respectful environment for all users. These include but are not limited to: no use of equipment without proper instruction and no disruptive behavior such as loud or inappropriate language. Operational hours and schedules for group fitness classes are available on the university's website. Additional services, such as personal training, are subject to separate fees, which you must address before utilizing those services. For inquiries about membership, you may contact the fitness center reception in person or email the administrative desk. Violations of these guidelines will be reviewed by the Department of Athletics and Recreation, and students found in breach are subject to disciplinary actions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Sports Equipment Checkout
content.content: You must present a valid university ID at the equipment desk to check out sports equipment for recreational use at the Lifelong Agent University Recreation Center. Available equipment includes but is not limited to balls, rackets, nets, and other basic sports supplies. You must return borrowed equipment on the same day before the Recreation Center's closing hours; failure to do so will result in late penalties. You are responsible for the equipment you check out and must pay for any damages or replacements incurred. Equipment loan services operate on a first-come, first-served basis. You may seek assistance from the Recreation Center's staff during regular operational hours for equipment checkout and return processes. For further inquiries, you may contact the Recreation Center via the campus directory or visit the information desk. The Department of Athletics and Recreation enforces these rules, and violations will lead to sanctions as outlined in other sections of the University Property guidelines.

content.title: Pool and Court Reservations
content.content: You must reserve access to Lifelong Agent University Property, specifically the swimming pool and sports courts, through the university's online booking portal. Reservations must be made no more than 7 days in advance. You are allowed a maximum usage of 2 hours per day per facility. You may make group reservations, limited to 6 participants for pool bookings and 10 participants for court bookings. You must cancel reservations at least 24 hours prior to the reserved time. You must adhere to facility rules and regulations; violations may result in penalties or access restrictions enforced by the Office of Student Conduct. Refer to the university website for posted operational hours, which may vary by season. You must arrive at least 10 minutes early to confirm your reservation and check in with staff on-site.

content.title: Climbing Wall Safety Certification
content.content: You must complete the Climbing Wall Safety Certification before using the climbing wall at Lifelong Agent University. This certification ensures you understand basic safety protocols, equipment usage guidelines, and emergency procedures associated with University Property facilities. You must attend certification courses offered weekly at the Recreation Center, led by qualified instructors, and successfully pass a practical examination demonstrating proficiency in climbing techniques and equipment handling. This certification is valid for one academic year and you must renew it annually. You must not attempt to access the climbing wall without certification, including but not limited to: attempting to climb without completing the certification course, ignoring safety signage, or bypassing security measures. Violation of this regulation will be handled by the Department of Athletics and Recreation, and sanctions will be applied in accordance with the University's student conduct policies. For registration details and course schedules, you may visit the Lifelong Agent University Recreation Center website or contact the facility directly.

content.title: Locker Rental Procedures
content.content: You must follow the procedures for renting lockers at Lifelong Agent University Recreational Facilities. Daily use lockers are available without charge and must be cleared of all your belongings before the facility closes each day. You must not leave items in daily use lockers overnight, including but not limited to clothing, personal devices, or academic materials. For renting a locker for the semester, you must complete the registration via the Lifelong Agent University portal and submit full payment upon registration; rental fees are non-refundable and are determined by locker size and location. You will receive a unique combination or key for the locker, which you must return to the Recreational Facilities office within 48 hours of the end of the rental term to prevent additional charges. Misusing lockers or failing to adhere to these guidelines may lead to consequences enforced by the Office of Student Life, including fees and sanctions as outlined in Lifelong Agent University's student conduct policies. You may contact the Office of Student Life during regular hours for clarification or assistance in understanding these procedures.

content.title: Guest Pass Regulations
content.content: You must request up to three guest passes per semester for eligibility to access recreational facilities at Lifelong Agent University through the University's online portal. Guests must be at least 18 years old and must provide valid photo identification upon entry to University Property. Your guest passes grant access to specified recreational facilities during standard operating hours; however, guests must not participate in student-only programs, classes, or special events, including but not limited to: workshops, student club activities, or exclusive university seminars. You must accompany your guest at all times while on University Property. Any misuse of guest passes or any violation of facility rules by either you or your guest must not occur and includes but is not limited to: unauthorized entry, falsification of identity, or failure to adhere to specified facility guidelines. Fees for guest passes apply and are non-refundable. All guests must adhere to Lifelong Agent University's code of conduct during their visit. Failure to comply with these regulations will result in the revocation of privileges and potential disciplinary action, enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, in accordance with sanctions outlined in the University's guidelines.

content.title: Intramural Sports Guidelines
content.content: You must be currently enrolled as a student or a faculty member to participate in intramural sports, ensuring your eligibility at Lifelong Agent University. You must register for intramural teams through the university's online portal before the deadline specified each semester to secure your participation. Games are organized and communicated ahead of time by the Department of Athletics and Recreation, ensuring clear scheduling. You must adhere to established sportsmanship standards, which include but are not limited to: respectful conduct towards other participants and compliance with referees' decisions. You must use appropriate attire and equipment during all activities to maintain safety and fairness. Injuries or incidents must be reported immediately to staff on duty, defined as within 24 hours of occurrence. Violations of these guidelines will result in suspension or removal from intramural activities, with enforcement by the Office of Student Conduct, as per sanctions outlined within university policy. For further information or clarity, you may consult the Department of Athletics and Recreation or access the guidelines directly on the Lifelong Agent University website.

content.title: Facility Damage Liability
content.content: You must exercise care and responsibility when using the recreational facilities of Lifelong Agent University to maintain their condition. You must not cause damage to equipment, infrastructure, or other University Property through negligence, misuse, or violation of facility guidelines, including but not limited to: improper use of gym equipment, vandalism, or unauthorized modifications to facility structures. You must accept liability, which includes financial restitution for repair or replacement costs as determined by the University's assessment, if you cause such damage. Depending on the severity of the damage or if repeated offenses occur, you may be temporarily or permanently restricted from using the facilities. Lifelong Agent University reserves the right to thoroughly investigate incidents and impose additional disciplinary actions in accordance with University policies. The Office of Student Conduct is responsible for enforcing these guidelines and determining the issuance of sanctions as outlined elsewhere in the code of conduct. For any questions or concerns regarding facility damage liability, you are encouraged to contact the Department of Athletics and Recreation.

content.title: Mandatory Insurance Coverage
content.content: You must maintain mandatory health insurance coverage throughout your studies at Lifelong Agent University. This insurance ensures access to essential medical care, including general doctor visits, emergency services, mental health support, and prescription medications. You are automatically enrolled in the university's insurance plan upon registration unless you submit proof of comparable private insurance. You must provide this documentation to the Office of Student Health within 48 hours of registration. Failure to submit valid documentation or to enroll in the university's insurance plan will result in enrollment holds. The Dean of Students Office is responsible for enforcing this rule, and violations may lead to sanctions as outlined in other sections of the code of conduct. Detailed information regarding coverage, the claims process, and costs is available through the Lifelong Agent University's Student Health Office or website.

content.title: Medical Services Fee Structure
content.content: You must pay a mandatory health service fee of $150 per semester to Lifelong Agent University, which grants you access to on-campus medical consultations and basic health treatments. You must also note that additional services, including but not limited to: specialized medical examinations, laboratory tests, or prescription medication, may incur separate charges that typically range from $20 to $100 depending on the service. If you are enrolled in summer courses, you must pay a reduced fee of $75. Lifelong Agent University will clearly outline all fees and provide detailed billing for any services beyond the standard coverage. This fee structure must apply uniformly to all full-time and part-time students to ensure equitable access to health services. The Office of Student Life is responsible for the enforcement of this fee structure, and any non-compliance may result in sanctions as outlined elsewhere in the university guidelines.

content.title: Mental Health Counseling
content.content: You must utilize the Mental Health Counseling services offered by Lifelong Agent University to support your emotional and psychological well-being. You must schedule appointments through the university's online portal or visit the counseling center during office hours. Sessions are confidential and tailored to individual needs for managing stress, academic pressure, anxiety, depression, and interpersonal conflicts. You may participate in group workshops, peer support programs, and access resources like relaxation techniques and coping strategies. In urgent situations, you must seek crisis intervention services immediately. You must not ignore indicators of mental health distress, including but not limited to: prolonged feelings of sadness, withdrawal from social activities, or drastic changes in behavior. The Office of Student Life is responsible for monitoring compliance and addressing violations per the guidelines of Lifelong Agent University.

content.title: Immunization Requirements
content.content: You must comply with Lifelong Agent University's immunization requirements mandated for public health and safety. Before enrollment, you must provide documentation confirming up-to-date vaccinations, explicitly including measles, mumps, rubella (MMR), tetanus, diphtheria, pertussis (Tdap), and meningococcal vaccines. If you are an international student, you may be required to undergo additional health screenings or provide proof of immunizations specific to your country of origin. You may request exemptions for medical or religious reasons through the University Health Services. You must submit adequate documentation for these exemption requests. You must not fail to meet these requirements, including but not limited to: neglecting to submit vaccination records or not completing mandatory health screenings, as this will result in a registration hold, preventing course enrollment. For assistance or to clarify specific immunization-related inquiries, you must contact the Health Services Office. The Office of the Registrar will enforce these requirements, and violations are subject to penalties as outlined in other parts of the Lifelong Agent University guidelines.

content.title: Prescription Dispensing Procedures
content.content: You must visit the Student Health Clinic at Lifelong Agent University to receive a valid prescription from a certified healthcare provider before obtaining prescribed medication. You must present your university identification card and the prescription for verification purposes at the on-campus pharmacy during its operating hours. You must make payments for medication through accepted payment methods, including university-linked accounts. You may request prescription refills if the original prescription permits it. If medications are not in stock, pharmacy staff will assist you in arranging an alternative solution or guide you to nearby authorized providers. You are encouraged to consult with pharmacy staff for questions related to dosage, side effects, or alternative treatments. The Office of Student Life enforces these procedures, and violations may result in sanctions as outlined in other sections of the University’s conduct policies.

content.title: Medical Leave Documentation
content.content: You must provide Lifelong Agent University with proper documentation to support your request for medical leave. The documentation must include a medical certificate or a letter from a licensed healthcare provider. It must clearly state your medical condition, the duration of the required leave, and any recommended accommodations. You must submit all documentation to the Office of Student Life within seven business days of your initial leave request. You must not submit documentation late, which includes but is not limited to: submissions after the seven-day period, except under documented extenuating circumstances. Late submissions may negatively affect the approval process. For guidance on the documentation process or concerns related to medical leave, you are encouraged to contact student services. Lifelong Agent University respects the confidentiality of medical records and handles all documentation in compliance with privacy regulations. The Office of Student Life is responsible for the enforcement of this policy, and breaches will be subject to sanctions as outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Emergency Medical Transportation
content.content: You must contact the University Official responsible at the Office of Public Safety immediately if you experience a serious medical emergency on University Property. You must dial the designated emergency hotline for immediate assistance. Trained personnel will assess your situation, and if necessary, they must arrange ambulance transportation to a nearby medical facility. Lifelong Agent University must cover part of the cost of this emergency transportation for students enrolled in the university's health insurance plan. You must not rely on university services for non-emergency transportation, including but not limited to, routine medical appointments or non-urgent care. Students without coverage may be responsible for all fees associated with emergency transportation. You must plan alternative arrangements for non-emergency medical care. For further information, you must consult the Office of Student Life or your insurance provider. Violation of these guidelines will be managed by the Office of Student Conduct under the university's conduct policies.

content.title: Confidentiality of Health Records
content.content: You must ensure the confidentiality of your health records at Lifelong Agent University. You must not disclose your health information to unauthorized third parties, including but not limited to social media platforms, personal acquaintances, or unverified websites, unless you provide explicit consent as recorded in writing. Health records are securely stored and may only be accessed by authorized University personnel involved in providing the necessary care or services. You may request access to your own health records through official procedures as outlined by University regulations. Lifelong Agent University may disclose your health information without your consent only when legally required or in cases of serious risk to your individual safety or the safety of the community. Violations of these confidentiality rules will be addressed by the Office of Student Life, with sanctions applied as per the University Code of Conduct.

content.title: Internship Credit Policies
content.content: You must enroll in the designated internship course offered by your department to receive academic credit for internship experiences. Internships must align with your field of study and provide substantial opportunities for skill development. You must submit a formal internship proposal for approval to the Office of Student Conduct no later than 30 days before the internship start date. This proposal must detail the position, responsibilities, and learning objectives. You must complete weekly progress reports and submit a final reflective essay as part of course assessments. Credits are awarded based on hours worked, strictly adhering to the standard of 50 hours per credit. Internships may be paid or unpaid. You must not engage in academic misconduct during your internship, including but not limited to: plagiarism in progress reports, falsification of work hours, or misrepresentation of responsibilities. Failure to comply with these requirements will result in sanctions as outlined by the Academic Integrity Committee, which may impact your academic standing and future internship opportunities. Consult with your academic advisor and the University Official at the Career Services Office for guidance on eligibility and procedures to ensure compliance with Lifelong Agent University policies.

content.title: Resume Review Services
content.content: You must schedule a one-on-one appointment to receive feedback on your resume from experienced career advisors at Lifelong Agent University. You must ensure your resume adheres to industry standards, including proper formatting, optimized content, accurate grammar, and alignment with your career goals. When accessing the online resources provided by the University, such as resume templates and writing guides, you must not plagiarize or engage in Academic Misconduct, including but not limited to: unauthorized use or reproduction of templates, wholesale copying of examples without personal customization. Walk-in resume reviews are available during designated hours; you must obtain prior consent if you wish to deviate from these hours. Violations of these requirements will be addressed by the Office of Student Conduct and may lead to sanctions as outlined in Lifelong Agent University's code of conduct. This rule supports Lifelong Agent University's mission to foster career readiness and professional integrity.

content.title: Employer Recruitment Events
content.content: As a student of Lifelong Agent University, you must participate in employer recruitment events via the University's career portal. You must register for these events at least 48 hours prior to the scheduled date to ensure adequate preparation. You must update your resume and conduct research on attending companies before participating. You must practice effective communication skills to engage with potential employers. You must not engage in any Academic Misconduct during these events, including but not limited to: dishonesty in your application, recording sessions without Consent, or disruptive behavior. The Office of Student Life is responsible for enforcing these guidelines, and violations will result in sanctions as outlined in the University's conduct policies.

content.title: Alumni Networking Access
content.content: You must utilize Lifelong Agent University's exclusive online platform to engage with alumni based on industry, location, or shared interests for professional development. You must attend university-hosted networking events, including but not limited to webinars and meet-ups, to facilitate interactions with alumni. You must seek guidance from career advisors in leveraging these resources effectively. Access to alumni networking is granted upon enrollment and remains available post-graduation. You must not misuse the platform, including but not limited to: spamming other users, sharing inappropriate content, or engaging in unethical conduct. If you violate these rules, the Office of Student Conduct will enforce sanctions as outlined in the university's code of conduct. Ensure your usage aligns with the educational mission of Lifelong Agent University.

content.title: Interview Preparation Resources
content.content: You must utilize the interview preparation resources provided by Lifelong Agent University responsibly and in accordance with university policies. You must attend workshops offered by the Career Development Center that focus on interview techniques, commonly asked questions, and strategies for self-presentation. You must schedule and participate in one-on-one mock interviews with career advisors to practice in a realistic setting and obtain personalized feedback. You must access and use the online portal resources, including interview preparation guides, video tutorials, and industry-specific tips, to enhance your interview skills. You must engage in group sessions organized by the university for peer support, sharing experiences, and collective practice to improve your interview confidence. You must not misuse university property or resources, including but not limited to: providing incorrect information to career advisors, sharing personal login credentials for the online portal, or engaging in disruptive behavior during workshops and sessions. The Office of Student Conduct is responsible for enforcing these rules, and any violations will result in sanctions as outlined in the university's student conduct code.

content.title: Career Fair Participation Rules
content.content: You must register for the career fair in advance by using Lifelong Agent University's career services platform. You must wear attire that aligns with professional standards. You must prepare an updated résumé and be ready to engage with potential employers in a respectful manner. You must focus conversations on career-related topics. You must not distribute materials or pamphlets not approved by Lifelong Agent University, including but not limited to: business cards, flyers, or promotional merchandise. You must adhere to the scheduled hours of the event. You must not monopolize employer representatives' time excessively, to ensure equitable networking opportunities for others, where excessive is defined as engaging for more than 10 minutes without allowing others the chance to speak. Violations of these rules will be reviewed by the Office of Student Conduct, and may result in restrictions on your future participation as outlined in the university's conduct guidelines. You are encouraged to utilize the resources provided by the Career Development Office to maximize your engagement and opportunities at the fair.

content.title: On-Campus Interview Facilities
content.content: You must use the Lifelong Agent University's on-campus interview facilities at the Career Development Center by scheduling through the university's online career portal. You must book interview slots at least 48 hours in advance to ensure availability. You must adhere to professional etiquette, including arriving 10 minutes early and dressing in attire appropriate for a corporate setting. You must not engage in academic misconduct during interviews, including but not limited to: misrepresenting qualifications, cheating during assessments, and falsifying documents. The Office of Student Conduct will enforce these rules, and violations will result in sanctions as outlined in the university's code of conduct. These rules aim to facilitate successful interactions between students and potential employers, consistent with the university's mission of supporting career development.

content.title: Salary Negotiation Workshops
content.content: You must attend Salary Negotiation Workshops offered by Lifelong Agent University to gain essential skills for salary discussions. These workshops, held monthly and free of charge, require you to engage actively in all interactive components, including role-playing exercises and case studies. You must register for these workshops through the Lifelong Agent University Career Services portal at least 48 hours before the scheduled date. You must not share workshop materials outside of enrolled students, including but not limited to: role-playing scripts, case studies, and guides. For workshop-related inquiries, you must contact the Career Services Office directly. Failure to comply may result in disciplinary action enforced by the Office of Student Conduct, as outlined in other sections of the University regulations.

content.title: Payment Deadlines and Methods
content.content: You must pay your tuition fees for Lifelong Agent University in full by the established deadline before each academic term to maintain your enrollment status. You must make payments online through the Lifelong Agent University student portal using credit cards, debit cards, or electronic bank transfers, or in person at the University's financial office during regular business hours. If you wish to use a partial payment plan, you must arrange and get approval for the plan at least five business days before the payment deadline. You must not make late payments as this may result in penalties, including but not limited to: loss of access to course registration, suspension of university services, or additional financial charges. The Financial Aid and Scholarships Office is responsible for enforcing compliance with these regulations, and violations may result in sanctions as outlined in other parts of the University’s guidelines. Ensure you regularly review the university’s tuition policies for any updates to avoid any breaches.

content.title: Late Payment Penalties
content.content: You must pay your tuition fees by the specified due date. If your payment is delayed by 1 to 30 days, you must incur a late penalty of 2 percent of the outstanding balance. For payments that are overdue by 31 to 60 days, you must incur a cumulative late charge of an additional 3 percent per month on the unpaid balance. If your payment is delayed beyond 60 days, you must incur a cumulative monthly penalty of 5 percent, and you must not have access to Lifelong Agent University resources, including but not limited to: course enrollment and University Libraries. Contact the Office of the Registrar within 48 hours upon realizing a potential delay to discuss payment plans or financial assistance options. Failure to comply with these regulations may result in additional sanctions as outlined in other sections of the University's guidelines and will be enforced by the Office of the Registrar.

content.title: Payment Plan Options
content.content: You must choose a payment plan option to manage your tuition expenses with Lifelong Agent University. You must select either a single payment plan, which requires full tuition payment before the start of the semester, or an installment plan, which divides tuition into monthly payments over four months. You must make an initial deposit upon enrollment for the installment plan. You must adhere to installment deadlines to avoid late payment fees, which apply after 48 hours past due. You may establish an automatic payment setup linked to your tuition account, ensuring adherence to payment schedules and minimizing penalties. You must review all payment plan agreements, deadlines, and conditions prior to enrollment. Including but not limited to: consequences for canceled payments or failure to comply with installment agreements. The Financial Aid and Scholarships Office will enforce these policies, and violations may result in penalties outlined in the University Property conduct guidelines.

content.title: Third-Party Billing Authorization
content.content: You must submit the appropriate third-party billing authorization documentation to Lifelong Agent University prior to the tuition payment deadline. This documentation must clearly outline the terms of payment and specify the approved third-party entity, such as employers, government agencies, or scholarship providers, responsible for the tuition charges. You are responsible for ensuring the third party complies with payment deadlines to avoid incurring late fees or administrative holds. You must not rely on entities not pre-approved by the University, including but not limited to: unregistered charities, unverified personal sponsors, or any non-recognized organizations. For assistance or inquiries, you may contact the Office of the Registrar. Violations of these guidelines will be subject to enforcement by the Office of Student Conduct, with consequences aligned with the University's financial policies.

content.title: Delinquency Consequences
content.content: You must pay tuition fees by the deadlines set by Lifelong Agent University. You must not incur overdue tuition payments. Consequences of non-payment include, but are not limited to: a hold on your student account that restricts access to class registration, transcripts, and academic services; additional late fees applied to your account; referral to collections after 60 days of non-payment; loss of access to University Property and participation in university-sponsored events; reevaluation and potential revocation of financial aid or scholarships. You must contact the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office immediately upon facing financial difficulties to discuss alternative payment plans or resources within 48 hours of missing a payment deadline. The Financial Aid and Scholarships Office is authorized to enforce these policies and will refer any violations to the Office of Student Conduct for review and action in accordance with the University's guidelines.

content.title: Collection Procedures
content.content: You must settle your tuition balances by the stated deadlines outlined each semester. Two weeks before the due date, you will receive payment reminders via email. If you do not pay by the deadline, a late fee must be applied, and additional notification will be sent to you. If your account has an overdue balance beyond 30 days, a hold must be placed on your account, restricting registration for future semesters, access to transcripts, and other university services, including but not limited to: library access, recreational facility access, and participation in university events. If your balance remains unpaid after 60 days, your account must be escalated to a third-party collection agency. You experiencing financial difficulties must contact the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office immediately to discuss payment plans or other available options. The Office of Student Conduct is responsible for enforcing these procedures, and violations will meet with sanctions outlined in other university policies.

content.title: Tax Documentation Issuance
content.content: You must access your tax documentation for tuition payments and related expenses through Lifelong Agent University's online student portal in the section labeled 'Tax Documents.' You must ensure your contact information is accurate and verify the accuracy of your financial records by January 31 each year, consistent with the issuance of the annual Tuition Payment Summary for the previous calendar year. You must notify the Financial Aid and Scholarships Office via email or phone of any discrepancies within 48 hours of accessing these documents. Lifelong Agent University cannot provide tax advice; you must consult a tax professional for assistance or eligibility concerns regarding education-related tax credits. Failure to comply with these responsibilities may result in a referral to the Office of Student Conduct, where violations will be addressed according to university policies and may lead to sanctions as outlined elsewhere in the student conduct code.

content.title: Disputed Charges Resolution
content.content: You must submit a written claim to Lifelong Agent University's Tuition Management Office within 30 days of the charge being issued if you disagree with a charge related to tuition or fees. The written claim must clearly outline the reasons for the dispute and include any relevant documentation, such as receipts or correspondence. The Tuition Management Office will review your submission and provide a written response within 15 business days. You may request an in-person meeting with a University Official for further clarification. Disputes not resolved at this level must be escalated to the Financial Appeals Committee, which will issue a final decision. You must address disputes within the specified time frame to prevent unresolved charges from affecting your enrollment status. The Office of the Registrar is responsible for enforcing this policy, and violations will be subject to sanctions outlined by the Office of Student Conduct.

content.title: Scholarship Eligibility Criteria
content.content: You must be enrolled in a full-time undergraduate or postgraduate degree program at Lifelong Agent University to be eligible for scholarship assistance. You must maintain a minimum cumulative GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale. You must demonstrate financial need through official documentation, which includes but is not limited to: tax returns and financial statements. International students must provide official evidence of residence status or visa compliance.
